title: Virtual FortiGate Security Appliance docs
introduction: The IBM Cloud® Virtual FortiGate Security Appliance provides performance, ease of configuration, and maintenance advantages with the simplicity of running on a bare metal server.

section_recommended.title: Getting started with IBM Cloud Virtual Fortigate Security Appliance
section_recommended.description: IBM Cloud® Virtual FortiGate Security Appliance allows you to route private and public network traffic selectively, through a full-featured, enterprise-level firewall that is powered by FortiOS software features, such as full routing stacks, QoS and traffic sharing, policy-based routing, and VPN, IPS, and IDP.

section_recommended.title: Accessing your FortiGate Virtual Security Appliance
section_recommended.description: The public interfaces of the Ubuntu hypervisor and the vFSA do not allow SSH access. Additionally, the vFSA web management console is disabled by default. You can use several different approaches to access these devices.

section_recommended.title: Managing VLANs with a gateway appliance
section_recommended.description: By using a gateway appliance and the IBM Cloud console, you can manage your VLANs with several actions.

tiles.title: Virtual FortiGate Security Appliance (vFSA)
tiles.description: General availability of the Virtual Fortigate Security Appliance on IBM Cloud.
